original_title: British Council to train English teachers in Sri Lanka’s Sabaragamuwa
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The British Council, Colombo, will provide formal training to enhance language, knowledge and teaching skills of English teachers in the Sabaragamuwa Province.

“Formal training will be given to selected 700 teachers through the Teaching Knowledge Test (TKT) course affiliated to the Cambridge University,” a statement by the Department of Government Information said.
The estimated cost of the program is 51 million rupees, which will come out of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council funds, according to the statement.

In November, President Ranil Wickramasinghe announced the commencement of the ‘English for All’ program to improve English literacy by 2030. While the program focused on school and university students, the training with the British Council seeks to improve the quality of English education. (Colombo/Dec20/2023)
